element.name: 13 A Walk in the Garden-Carrigvore by Kili or bust, Traditional Cache (1.5/3.5)

center.font: Visit The Geocaching Ireland discussion forum HERE

element.long-description:
The map above indicates 5 caches that are virtually "in a row". It is quite a walk to get all of them but on a summer day it would be nice. You can of course come back down to the Military Road at many points along the way and if you decide to do the lot then you would have a long road walk back to a car. There is a newer car park at the exit from the mountains at Carrigshouk. With a car parked at either end a group could manage this quite well.
You can park at N53 07.052 W 006 18.110 or at any spot along the Military Road at the Sally gap area that you can. Not too many clear trails up to this and the terrain is tough enough. Good water proof boots are a must and gaiters would be good. Weather very changeable and clouds can roll in pretty quickly so compass and map (Discovery Series No. 56) essential. Views are wonderful so well worth the effort.
Carrigvore is 682 metres above sea level but the climb from the road is less than half of that. After some trouble getting a fix on some city park locations because of trees etc. I decided on this location because it was much easier to get reliable coords. I also brought a fellow cacher and his GPS to be sure.
The cache is a decontamination box. It is situated in a rock formation.
Contents of cache:
Log Book pen and pencil
Streamers
Fire extinguisher key ring
GPS batteries
ILAC pen
scissors
Silver Spanish ring
Practice golf ball
coaster
candle
element.encoded-hints: Slightly below and to one side of a large rock formation.

ul.li:
2010-05-23T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by roybrindley
Hi - tried to find this one but was on a long hike with limited time so maybe its still there but I had no luck. TFTC

2010-05-07T12:06:44Z : Enable Listing by Kili or bust
This one is back up and running. I replaced the cache at the same location but slghtly lower down.

2010-04-30T10:39:08Z : Temporarily Disable Listing by Kili or bust
On a maintenance visit I found the cache but all contents missing and lying open. Will replace prperly as soon as it is possible.

2009-12-28T20:00:00Z : Found it by Rita666
It was hard to go up there. But I did it! :)) And it was only begining of my diurnal walking through the Wicklow mountains. Hello from Latvia! Thanks for the cache!

2009-11-15T20:00:00Z : Found it by Sordini
Great cache. Easy 45 min walk with the road.

wpt.name: GCMVP2
